data.headline: Nasdaq recovered to close up 0.1% as Apple jumped over 3% on reports of accelerated AI wearable development.
bullets: ZIM Integrated Shipping surged on a $4.2B buyout bid, highlighting active M&A flows.
Paramount rose about 5% amid ongoing Skydance and Warner Bros. Discovery deal speculation, with Warner Bros. also active.
GE Aerospace climbed 3–4% toward record highs, boosting aerospace and defense stocks.
Transports rebounded, with Southwest up around 7% and RXO higher as AI logistics fears eased.
Bayer rallied in Frankfurt on a $7.25B Roundup settlement announcement.
Other notable movers included Rivian, Norwegian Cruise Line, Wingstop, Palantir (on Miami HQ shift), and Ormat Technologies (Google geothermal deal).
Oil and gold prices eased as progress in Iran–US nuclear talks weighed on safe-haven demand.
No major economic data or fresh Fed commentary left traders focused on upcoming results from Palo Alto Networks, Nvidia, and Walmart, as well as key inflation, GDP, and Fed updates later in the week.
